DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure HIV p24 Antigen Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._HIV-p24 antigen, an important core protein of the human immunodeficiency virus, is encoded by the gag gene. This protein can be detected in serum either in its free form or bound by anti-p24 antibody. Individuals who are HIV-seropositive elicit a significant immune response to p24. Thus, detection of p24 antibodies by ELISA or Western analysis is a screening method utilized to determine the presence of HIV._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._HIV-p24 antigen, an important core protein of the human immunodeficiency virus, is encoded by the gag gene. This protein can be detected in serum either in its free form or bound by anti-p24 antibody. Individuals who are HIV-seropositive elicit a significant immune response to p24. Thus, detection of p24 antibodies by ELISA or Western analysis is a screening method utilized to determine the presence of HIV.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: HIV-p24 antigen, an important core protein of the human immunodeficiency virus, is encoded by the gag gene. This protein can be detected in serum either in its free form or bound by anti-p24 antibody. Individuals who are HIV-seropositive elicit a significant immune response to p24. Thus, detection of p24 antibodies by ELISA or Western analysis is a screening method utilized to determine the presence of HIV.

Concepts.definition: HIV-p24 antigen, an important core protein of the human immunodeficiency virus, is encoded by the gag gene. This protein can be detected in serum either in its free form or bound by anti-p24 antibody. Individuals who are HIV-seropositive elicit a significant immune response to p24. Thus, detection of p24 antibodies by ELISA or Western analysis is a screening method utilized to determine the presence of HIV.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
